channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: PM Jacinda Ardern reveals staggered move to alert level 2
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has announced a staggered move into level 2 starting on Thursday, with schools and bars reopening later and groups limited to 10 people.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 11 May
item.description: The government has announced it will move New Zealand from alert level 3 to level 2 through various stages starting on Monday. Follow live updates with RNZ's blog here.

item.title: Three new confirmed cases of Covid-19, no deaths as level 2 decision looms
item.description: As the government decides whether the country can move to level 2 or not, it has been confirmed that there are three new cases of Covid-19.

item.title: Escaped prisoner arrested in Upper Hutt after search
item.description: Police have arrested a 29-year-old man who escaped custody yesterday evening.

item.title: Women's Refuge welcomes extra funding for family and sexual violence services
item.description: Extra government funding for family violence services is timely given there will be an increase of demand for months, or possibly years to come, Women's Refuge says.

item.title: Westpac banking services down
item.description: Westpac services are down with its customers unable to carry out banking.

item.title: Covid-19 could revive single-use plastics - agribusiness head
item.description: The Covid-19 crisis could be a big setback to progress on eliminating plastics, a rural expert has warned.

item.title: Robotic dolphin causing stir in aquariums while solving ethical dilemma
item.description: As Chinese zoos and aquariums grapple with new bans on wildlife trade, a New Zealand tech entrepreneur is seeing unexpected interest in her latest project.

item.title: Bigger cities more at risk of Covid-19 flare-up at alert level 2 - data modeller
item.description: Auckland is at greater risk from the coronavirus flare-up than the rest of the country, a leading Covid-19 data modeller says.

item.title: Covid-19: Vodafone disconnects elderly customer during lockdown
item.description: An elderly woman had her phone line and internet disconnected by Vodafone during lockdown because of an overdue account - caused by the the company's own admin bungle.

item.title: Wrangling zumba and zoom for seniors during the lockdown
item.description: At-home workouts and online group fitness classes have become the norm for many during the Covid-19 lockdown - including for a group of Edgecumbe seniors.

item.title: Schools under level 2: Teaching changes and a lot more hand washing
item.description: Timetable changes, zoom meetings and a lot more hand washing will be features of the new-look schooling awaiting more than 800,000 children and teachers under alert level 2.

item.title: Costly legal action may await over mishandling of redundancy issue
item.description: Work and Income may face a costly class action lawsuit after it appears to have spent decades wrongly advising some benefit applicants that they cannot get support until their redundancy runs out.

item.title: Concern as veteran leader pushes for poll on Tokelau independence
item.description: A Tokelauan leader has drafted a referendum on the territory moving to independence from New Zealand to be held by 2025.

item.title: 'It's transformative' - Health and job benefits from plan to fix damp homes
item.description: The Green Building Council is proposing a housing plan it says would be a quick-fire way to stimulate the economy in the wake of Covid-19.

item.title: Abuse survivors worried they lack a voice at inquiry
item.description: The Royal Commission investigating historic abuse in care has quietly suspended meetings of the group of survivors set up to advise it.

item.title: Lung cancer victims miss out in drug funding boost - advocates
item.description: Advocates for lung cancer sufferers say the extra funding for Pharmac in this year's Budget won't help them.

item.title: Government to invest millions into family violence services
item.description: The government is investing an extra $202 million over the next four years to strengthen family and sexual violence services.
